page.title: 01Swanley Forest by Stonehaven
page.content: The block is comprised of the mid-section of the Cowie valley with, to the N. of the river, Glenton Hill (174m) and to the S. the ridge formed by the Hill of Swanley (229m) and Cheyne Hill (170m). The Hill of Swanley has mature coniferous forest connecting to the W. with Fetteresso Forest. Some felling has occurred between minor road and river in Square 2. Glenton Hill (sq.3) is heathland with young conifer plantations on its low southern slopes but with farmland to both W (sqs. 1 & 2) and E (sqs. 3 & 4). Cheyne Hill (sq. 8) is rough grazing land (where an old wood used to be) surrounded by coniferous plantations to N and NW, although invading birch is dominant on the lower southern and western slopes. The southern slopes of Hill of Swanley are intensively farmed (sqs. 9,10,11 & 12)
